summary: i drew pokemans!! i never draw pokemans ;ol this was another idea i had a while ago, to draw Marie my Eevee/Espeon and Yuko my...
caption:
i drew pokemans!! i never draw pokemans ;ol

this was another idea i had a while ago, to draw Marie my Eevee/Espeon and Yuko my Alolan Vulpix playing together in the snow, but i just didn’t get to it….until now. this came out so cute, i am just so thrilled with this ^^

blog.title: She Has A Lot Of Things To Say!
blog.description: Piplup is a good pokemon! 💙Submissions and art always welcome! 💙If you need something tagged, please do not hesitate to ask! 💙This blog is LGBTQ friendly as the owner is bisexual. 💙Mean homophobic and transphobic comments get deleted and blocked, so save your breath 💙 I track ‘today-piplup-says’ ! 💙¡hablo un poco español!💙 (Run by Cass)

body: Recovery is not an always an easy road. It can be scary, and messy. That’s okay. Recovery is not perfect, and neither are you. Let yourself be messy. It takes time to truly heal after being hurt. Relax and let the healing begin. Time heals all wounds.

reblog.comment: Recovery is not an always an easy road. It can be scary, and messy. That’s okay. Recovery is not perfect, and neither are you. Let yourself be messy. It takes time to truly heal after being hurt. Relax and let the healing begin. Time heals all wounds.

trail.content_raw: Recovery is not an always an easy road. It can be scary, and messy. That’s okay. Recovery is not perfect, and neither are you. Let yourself be messy. It takes time to truly heal after being hurt. Relax and let the healing begin. Time heals all wounds.
trail.content: Recovery is not an always an easy road. It can be scary, and messy. That’s okay. Recovery is not perfect, and neither are you. Let yourself be messy. It takes time to truly heal after being hurt. Relax and let the healing begin. Time heals all wounds.

summary: Not sure if everyone noticed this, but all of the main cast (minus Margo) were all seen riding together from the very beginning...
caption: Not sure if everyone noticed this, but all of the main cast (minus Margo) were all seen riding together from the very beginning of this movie when Ash first arrives at Fula City. Little did they know how all of them would work as a team with their Pokémon to save the city from destruction later on…

blog.name: friendsafariserver
blog.title: Friend Safari!
blog.description:
Friend Safari is a SFW, OC-friendly, paragraph-style roleplay server for main series Pokémon games. From Kanto to Alola, the whole Pokémon world is your Cloyster! Members of this server are allowed a total of four played characters, with at least one required to be canonical.

The server is run by a team of five mods who you can learn more about via the mods page. We cultivate an easygoing and open atmosphere, with member comfort and happiness being our top priority.

All of the links are in the drop down menu under Rowlet, labeled Pokémon! Hovering over each Pokémon will tell you what page they link to!

summary: Welcome to the Friend Safari! Friend Safari is a Discord-based paragraph roleplay group. With channels for every region,...
body:
Welcome to the Friend Safari!

Friend Safari is a Discord-based paragraph roleplay group. With channels for every region, multiple modes for character interactions, and plenty of in-character events, ours is an active and welcoming group always looking for new members! To learn more about our server, head over to our rules!

Reblog this ad, stop by our blog and check us out!

summary: And here’s the Ultra Sun team as of the second grand challenge.  Their personalities are coming into better focus, whether...
caption:
And here’s the Ultra Sun team as of the second grand challenge.  Their personalities are coming into better focus, whether through evolution or just spending more time with them.  Archimedes thinks he’s too cool for school, always trying to act cool and aloof, but he’s still an awkward borb at heart, with a tendency to trip over his own feet.  Olynder’s a natural star who has an easy time commanding attention, while Sparky’s still the attention hungry and somewhat needy sort always trying to jump into others limelight, to the point of becoming disheartened or causing restless trouble if left to himself for too long.  Hank and Liir are still adorable, affectionate babies with smiles so bright you need sunscreen, but they’re also somewhat impish and will take advantage of any distractions (particularly those caused by Sparky’s attention-seeking) to cause mischief, particularly in terms of getting Nebby or Ghost Gum in trouble.  Or, at least, they used to get Ghost Gum in trouble, but now that she’s BIG and STRONG she likes to turn their pranks back on them, and in particular she tries to protect Nebby from their antics.

So far I’m having a lot of fun with this crew, but maybe not quite as much fun as some of my past teams.  Both of my USUM teams now have been somewhat haphazard and circumstantial collections of shiny pokemon that I worked to hatch individually, rather than coherent groups where each pokemon was chosen as part of a particular team, balanced against the types, aesthetics, and personalities of each other, the way most of my teams have been since gen 6.  Between that and playing the game in Spanish (for masuda purposes), which I can only barely sorta understand, it’s kind of separated me a bit from the experience this time around.  Even so, this lot has grown on me quite a bit, and the growing size of my shiny ghost collection continues to be quite satisfying in it’s own right.

So far I’m having a lot of fun with this crew, but maybe not quite as much fun as some of my past teams.  Both of my USUM teams now have been somewhat haphazard and circumstantial collections of shiny pokemon that I worked to hatch individually, rather than coherent groups where each pokemon was chosen as part of a particular team, balanced against the types, aesthetics, and personalities of each other, the way most of my teams have been since gen 6.  Between that and playing the game in Spanish (for masuda purposes), which I can only barely sorta understand, it’s kind of separated me a bit from the experience this time around.  Even so, this lot has grown on me quite a bit, and the growing size of my shiny ghost collection continues to be quite satisfying in it’s own right.

And here’s the Ultra Sun team as of the second grand challenge.  Their personalities are coming into better focus, whether through evolution or just spending more time with them.  Archimedes thinks he’s too cool for school, always trying to act cool and aloof, but he’s still an awkward borb at heart, with a tendency to trip over his own feet.  Olynder’s a natural star who has an easy time commanding attention, while Sparky’s still the attention hungry and somewhat needy sort always trying to jump into others limelight, to the point of becoming disheartened or causing restless trouble if left to himself for too long.  Hank and Liir are still adorable, affectionate babies with smiles so bright you need sunscreen, but they’re also somewhat impish and will take advantage of any distractions (particularly those caused by Sparky’s attention-seeking) to cause mischief, particularly in terms of getting Nebby or Ghost Gum in trouble.  Or, at least, they used to get Ghost Gum in trouble, but now that she’s BIG and STRONG she likes to turn their pranks back on them, and in particular she tries to protect Nebby from their antics.

So far I’m having a lot of fun with this crew, but maybe not quite as much fun as some of my past teams.  Both of my USUM teams now have been somewhat haphazard and circumstantial collections of shiny pokemon that I worked to hatch individually, rather than coherent groups where each pokemon was chosen as part of a particular team, balanced against the types, aesthetics, and personalities of each other, the way most of my teams have been since gen 6.  Between that and playing the game in Spanish (for masuda purposes), which I can only barely sorta understand, it’s kind of separated me a bit from the experience this time around.  Even so, this lot has grown on me quite a bit, and the growing size of my shiny ghost collection continues to be quite satisfying in it’s own right.
trail.content:
And here’s the Ultra Sun team as of the second grand challenge.  Their personalities are coming into better focus, whether through evolution or just spending more time with them.  Archimedes thinks he’s too cool for school, always trying to act cool and aloof, but he’s still an awkward borb at heart, with a tendency to trip over his own feet.  Olynder’s a natural star who has an easy time commanding attention, while Sparky’s still the attention hungry and somewhat needy sort always trying to jump into others limelight, to the point of becoming disheartened or causing restless trouble if left to himself for too long.  Hank and Liir are still adorable, affectionate babies with smiles so bright you need sunscreen, but they’re also somewhat impish and will take advantage of any distractions (particularly those caused by Sparky’s attention-seeking) to cause mischief, particularly in terms of getting Nebby or Ghost Gum in trouble.  Or, at least, they used to get Ghost Gum in trouble, but now that she’s BIG and STRONG she likes to turn their pranks back on them, and in particular she tries to protect Nebby from their antics.

So far I’m having a lot of fun with this crew, but maybe not quite as much fun as some of my past teams.  Both of my USUM teams now have been somewhat haphazard and circumstantial collections of shiny pokemon that I worked to hatch individually, rather than coherent groups where each pokemon was chosen as part of a particular team, balanced against the types, aesthetics, and personalities of each other, the way most of my teams have been since gen 6.  Between that and playing the game in Spanish (for masuda purposes), which I can only barely sorta understand, it’s kind of separated me a bit from the experience this time around.  Even so, this lot has grown on me quite a bit, and the growing size of my shiny ghost collection continues to be quite satisfying in it’s own right.

photos.caption: Olynder's shaping up to be quite a star
Archimedes is a bit of a heartbreaker
Sparky still loves to be the center of attention
Liir's smile is like a ray of sunshine
Big and beefy, Ghost Gum is the team's anchor
Hank is still just a precious baby, but he's also quite a prankster

tags: i think leaf may actually have been taken by the light so my idea wouldn't work the way i thought of it anymore
summary: Remember how I was thinking of writing a World of Light fanfic about Dark Meta Knight and Pokemon Trainer Leaf/Blue/Green...
body: Remember how I was thinking of writing a World of Light fanfic about Dark Meta Knight and Pokemon Trainer Leaf/Blue/Green exploring the world(s) in search of the source of whatever was happening? I just realized that since DMK doesn’t speak to canonically speak, Leaf would probably come up with her own name for him and just call him that for the entire story.
